types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

The list of required fields is dynamic and depends on the country code (use the `addressValidationRules` query to fetch them). Note: country code is mandatory for all addresses regardless of the rules provided in this input.

inputFields.name: checkFieldsFormat

inputFields.name: enableFieldsNormalization
inputFields.description: Determines if Saleor should apply normalization on address fields. Example: converting city field to uppercase letters.

types.name: CheckoutAuthorizeStatusEnum
types.description:
Determine a current authorize status for checkout.

    We treat the checkout as fully authorized when the sum of authorized and charged
    funds cover the checkout.total.
    We treat the checkout as partially authorized when the sum of authorized and charged
    funds covers only part of the checkout.total
    We treat the checkout as not authorized when the sum of authorized and charged funds
    is 0.

    NONE - the funds are not authorized
    PARTIAL - the cover funds don't cover fully the checkout's total
    FULL - the cover funds covers the checkout's total

types.name: CheckoutBillingAddressUpdate
types.description: Update billing address in the existing checkout.

fields.description: An updated checkout.

fields.name: checkoutErrors
fields.deprecationReason: This field will be removed in Saleor 4.0. Use `errors` field instead.

types.name: CheckoutChargeStatusEnum
types.description:
Determine the current charge status for the checkout.

    The checkout is considered overcharged when the sum of the transactionItem's charge
    amounts exceeds the value of `checkout.total`.
    If the sum of the transactionItem's charge amounts equals
    `checkout.total`, we consider the checkout to be fully charged.
    If the sum of the transactionItem's charge amounts covers a part of the
    `checkout.total`, we treat the checkout as partially charged.


    NONE - the funds are not charged.
    PARTIAL - the funds that are charged don't cover the checkout's total
    FULL - the funds that are charged fully cover the checkout's total
    OVERCHARGED - the charged funds are bigger than checkout's total

types.name: MarkAsPaidStrategyEnum
types.description:
Determine the mark as paid strategy for the channel.

    `TransactionItem` object, that will cover the `order.total`.

    PAYMENT_FLOW - new orders marked as paid will receive a
    `Payment` object, that will cover the `order.total`.

fields.name: webhookCreate
fields.description:
Creates a new webhook subscription. 

Requires one of the following permissions: MANAGE_APPS, AUTHENTICATED_APP.

args.name: input
args.description: Fields required to create a webhook.

fields.name: webhookDelete
fields.description:
Delete a webhook. Before the deletion, the webhook is deactivated to pause any deliveries that are already scheduled. The deletion might fail if delivery is in progress. In such a case, the webhook is not deleted but remains deactivated. 

Requires one of the following permissions: MANAGE_APPS, AUTHENTICATED_APP.

args.name: id
args.description: ID of a webhook to delete.

fields.name: webhookUpdate
fields.description:
Updates a webhook subscription. 

Requires one of the following permissions: MANAGE_APPS.

args.name: id
args.description: ID of a webhook to update.

args.name: input
args.description: Fields required to update a webhook.

fields.name: eventDeliveryRetry
fields.description:
Retries event delivery. 

Requires one of the following permissions: MANAGE_APPS.

args.name: id
args.description: ID of the event delivery to retry.

fields.name: webhookDryRun
fields.description:
Performs a dry run of a webhook event. Supports a single event (the first, if multiple provided in the `query`). Requires permission relevant to processed event.

Added in Saleor 3.11.

Note: this API is currently in Feature Preview and can be subject to changes at later point. 

Requires one of the following permissions: AUTHENTICATED_STAFF_USER.

args.name: objectId
args.description: The ID of an object to serialize.

args.name: query
args.description: The subscription query that defines the webhook event and its payload.

fields.name: webhookTrigger
fields.description:
Trigger a webhook event. Supports a single event (the first, if multiple provided in the `webhook.subscription_query`). Requires permission relevant to processed event. Successfully delivered webhook returns `delivery` with status='PENDING' and empty payload.

Added in Saleor 3.11.

Note: this API is currently in Feature Preview and can be subject to changes at later point. 

Requires one of the following permissions: AUTHENTICATED_STAFF_USER.

args.name: objectId
args.description: The ID of an object to serialize.

args.name: webhookId
args.description: The ID of the webhook.

Requires one of the following permissions: MANAGE_TAXES.

fields.name: paymentGatewayInitialize
fields.description:
Initializes a payment gateway session. It triggers the webhook `PAYMENT_GATEWAY_INITIALIZE_SESSION`, to the requested `paymentGateways`. If `paymentGateways` is not provided, the webhook will be send to all subscribed payment gateways.

Added in Saleor 3.13.

Note: this API is currently in Feature Preview and can be subject to changes at later point.

args.name: amount
args.description: The amount requested for initializing the payment gateway. If not provided, the difference between checkout.total - transactions that are already processed will be send.

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of the checkout or order.

args.name: paymentGateways
args.description: List of payment gateways to initialize.

fields.name: transactionInitialize
fields.description:
Initializes a transaction session. It triggers the webhook `TRANSACTION_INITIALIZE_SESSION`, to the requested `paymentGateways`. 

Added in Saleor 3.13.

Note: this API is currently in Feature Preview and can be subject to changes at later point.

args.name: action
args.description: The expected action called for the transaction. By default, the `channel.defaultTransactionFlowStrategy` will be used. The field can be used only by app that has `HANDLE_PAYMENTS` permission.

args.name: amount
args.description: The amount requested for initializing the payment gateway. If not provided, the difference between checkout.total - transactions that are already processed will be send.

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of the checkout or order.

args.name: paymentGateway
args.description: Payment gateway used to initialize the transaction.

fields.name: transactionProcess
fields.description:
Processes a transaction session. It triggers the webhook `TRANSACTION_PROCESS_SESSION`, to the assigned `paymentGateways`. 

Added in Saleor 3.13.

Note: this API is currently in Feature Preview and can be subject to changes at later point.

args.name: data
args.description: The data that will be passed to the payment gateway.

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of the transaction to process.

types.name: OrderAuthorizeStatusEnum
types.description:
Determine a current authorize status for order.

    We treat the order as fully authorized when the sum of authorized and charged funds
    cover the `order.total`-`order.totalGrantedRefund`.
    We treat the order as partially authorized when the sum of authorized and charged
    funds covers only part of the `order.total`-`order.totalGrantedRefund`.
    We treat the order as not authorized when the sum of authorized and charged funds is
    0.

    NONE - the funds are not authorized
    PARTIAL - the funds that are authorized and charged don't cover fully the
    `order.total`-`order.totalGrantedRefund`
    FULL - the funds that are authorized and charged fully cover the
    `order.total`-`order.totalGrantedRefund`

types.name: OrderChargeStatusEnum
types.description:
Determine the current charge status for the order.

    An order is considered overcharged when the sum of the
    transactionItem's charge amounts exceeds the value of
    `order.total` - `order.totalGrantedRefund`.
    If the sum of the transactionItem's charge amounts equals
    `order.total` - `order.totalGrantedRefund`, we consider the order to be fully
    charged.
    If the sum of the transactionItem's charge amounts covers a part of the
    `order.total` - `order.totalGrantedRefund`, we treat the order as partially charged.

    NONE - the funds are not charged.
    PARTIAL - the funds that are charged don't cover the
    `order.total`-`order.totalGrantedRefund`
    FULL - the funds that are charged fully cover the
    `order.total`-`order.totalGrantedRefund`
    OVERCHARGED - the charged funds are bigger than the
    `order.total`-`order.totalGrantedRefund`

types.name: OrderSettings
types.description: Represents the channel-specific order settings.

fields.name: automaticallyConfirmAllNewOrders
fields.description: When disabled, all new orders from checkout will be marked as unconfirmed. When enabled orders from checkout will become unfulfilled immediately.

fields.name: automaticallyFulfillNonShippableGiftCard
fields.description: When enabled, all non-shippable gift card orders will be fulfilled automatically.

fields.name: expireOrdersAfter
fields.description:
Expiration time in minutes. Default null - means do not expire any orders.

Added in Saleor 3.13.

Note: this API is currently in Feature Preview and can be subject to changes at later point.

fields.name: markAsPaidStrategy
fields.description:
Determine what strategy will be used to mark the order as paid. Based on the chosen option, the proper object will be created and attached to the order when it's manually marked as paid.
`PAYMENT_FLOW` - [default option] creates the `Payment` object.
`TRANSACTION_FLOW` - creates the `TransactionItem` object.

Added in Saleor 3.13.

Note: this API is currently in Feature Preview and can be subject to changes at later point.

fields.name: defaultTransactionFlowStrategy
fields.description:
Determine the transaction flow strategy to be used. Include the selected option in the payload sent to the payment app, as a requested action for the transaction.

Added in Saleor 3.13.

Note: this API is currently in Feature Preview and can be subject to changes at later point.

fields.name: field
fields.description: Name of a field that caused the error. A value of `null` indicates that the error isn't associated with a particular field.

fields.name: message
fields.description: The error message.

fields.name: code
fields.description: The error code.

types.name: OrderSettingsErrorCode
types.description: An enumeration.

inputFields.name: automaticallyConfirmAllNewOrders
inputFields.description: When disabled, all new orders from checkout will be marked as unconfirmed. When enabled orders from checkout will become unfulfilled immediately. By default set to True

inputFields.name: automaticallyFulfillNonShippableGiftCard
inputFields.description: When enabled, all non-shippable gift card orders will be fulfilled automatically. By defualt set to True.

inputFields.name: expireOrdersAfter
inputFields.description:
Expiration time in minutes. Default null - means do not expire any orders. Enter 0 or null to disable.

Added in Saleor 3.13.

Note: this API is currently in Feature Preview and can be subject to changes at later point.

inputFields.name: markAsPaidStrategy
inputFields.description:
Determine what strategy will be used to mark the order as paid. Based on the chosen option, the proper object will be created and attached to the order when it's manually marked as paid.
`PAYMENT_FLOW` - [default option] creates the `Payment` object.
`TRANSACTION_FLOW` - creates the `TransactionItem` object.

Added in Saleor 3.13.

Note: this API is currently in Feature Preview and can be subject to changes at later point.

inputFields.name: defaultTransactionFlowStrategy
inputFields.description:
Determine the transaction flow strategy to be used. Include the selected option in the payload sent to the payment app, as a requested action for the transaction.

Added in Saleor 3.13.

Note: this API is currently in Feature Preview and can be subject to changes at later point.

enumValues.name: RANK
enumValues.description: Sort products by rank. Note: This option is available only with the `search` filter.

enumValues.name: PRICE
enumValues.description:
Sort products by price.

This option requires a channel filter to work as the values can vary between channels.

enumValues.name: MINIMAL_PRICE
enumValues.description:
Sort products by a minimal price of a product's variant.

This option requires a channel filter to work as the values can vary between channels.

enumValues.name: PUBLISHED
enumValues.description:
Sort products by publication status.

This option requires a channel filter to work as the values can vary between channels.

enumValues.name: PUBLICATION_DATE
enumValues.description:
Sort products by publication date.

This option requires a channel filter to work as the values can vary between channels.

enumValues.name: PUBLISHED_AT
enumValues.description:
Sort products by publication date.

This option requires a channel filter to work as the values can vary between channels.

enumValues.name: COLLECTION
enumValues.description:
Sort products by collection. Note: This option is available only for the `Collection.products` query.

This option requires a channel filter to work as the values can vary between channels.

enumValues.name: CREATED_AT
enumValues.description:
Sort products by creation date.

inputFields.name: taxCode
inputFields.description:
Tax rate for enabled tax gateway. 

DEPRECATED: this field will be removed in Saleor 4.0.. Use tax classes to control the tax calculation for a product type. If taxCode is provided, Saleor will try to find a tax class with given code (codes are stored in metadata) and assign it. If no tax class is found, it would be created and assigned.

args.description: Destination address used to find warehouses where stock availability for this product is checked. If address is empty, uses `Shop.companyAddress` or fallbacks to server's `settings.DEFAULT_COUNTRY` configuration.

args.description:
Two-letter ISO 3166-1 country code.

fields.name: quantityAvailable
fields.description: Quantity of a product available for sale in one checkout. Field value will be `null` when no `limitQuantityPerCheckout` in global settings has been set, and `productVariant` stocks are not tracked.

args.name: address
args.description: Destination address used to find warehouses where stock availability for this product is checked. If address is empty, uses `Shop.companyAddress` or fallbacks to server's `settings.DEFAULT_COUNTRY` configuration.

args.name: countryCode
args.description:
Two-letter ISO 3166-1 country code. When provided, the exact quantity from a warehouse operating in shipping zones that contain this country will be returned. Otherwise, it will return the maximum quantity from all shipping zones. 

DEPRECATED: this field will be removed in Saleor 4.0. Use `address` argument instead.

types.name: StorePaymentMethodEnum

enumValues.name: ON_SESSION
enumValues.description: On session storage type. The payment is stored only to be reused when the customer is present in the checkout flow.

enumValues.name: OFF_SESSION
enumValues.description: Off session storage type. The payment is stored to be reused even if the customer is absent.

enumValues.name: NONE
enumValues.description: Storage is disabled. The payment is not stored.

types.name: TransactionEventTypeEnum
types.description:
Represents possible event types.

    Added in Saleor 3.12.

    The following types are possible:
    AUTHORIZATION_SUCCESS - represents success authorization.
    AUTHORIZATION_FAILURE - represents failure authorization.
    AUTHORIZATION_ADJUSTMENT - represents authorization adjustment.
    AUTHORIZATION_REQUEST - represents authorization request.
    AUTHORIZATION_ACTION_REQUIRED - represents authorization that needs
    additional actions from the customer.
    CHARGE_ACTION_REQUIRED - represents charge that needs
    additional actions from the customer.
    CHARGE_SUCCESS - represents success charge.
    CHARGE_FAILURE - represents failure charge.
    CHARGE_BACK - represents chargeback.
    CHARGE_REQUEST - represents charge request.
    REFUND_SUCCESS - represents success refund.
    REFUND_FAILURE - represents failure refund.
    REFUND_REVERSE - represents reverse refund.
    REFUND_REQUEST - represents refund request.
    CANCEL_SUCCESS - represents success cancel.
    CANCEL_FAILURE - represents failure cancel.
    CANCEL_REQUEST - represents cancel request.
    INFO - represents info event.

types.name: TransactionFlowStrategyEnum
types.description:
Determine the transaction flow strategy.

    AUTHORIZATION - the processed transaction should be only authorized
    CHARGE - the processed transaction should be charged.

args.name: after
args.description: Return the elements in the list that come after the specified cursor.

args.name: last

types.name: WebhookDelete
types.description:
Delete a webhook. Before the deletion, the webhook is deactivated to pause any deliveries that are already scheduled. The deletion might fail if delivery is in progress. In such a case, the webhook is not deleted but remains deactivated. 

Requires one of the following permissions: MANAGE_APPS, AUTHENTICATED_APP.

types.name: WebhookDryRun
types.description:

Added in Saleor 3.11.

Note: this API is currently in Feature Preview and can be subject to changes at later point. 

Requires one of the following permissions: AUTHENTICATED_STAFF_USER.

types.name: WebhookTrigger
types.description:
Trigger a webhook event. Supports a single event (the first, if multiple provided in the `webhook.subscription_query`). Requires permission relevant to processed event. Successfully delivered webhook returns `delivery` with status='PENDING' and empty payload.

Added in Saleor 3.11.

Note: this API is currently in Feature Preview and can be subject to changes at later point. 

Requires one of the following permissions: AUTHENTICATED_STAFF_USER.

types.name: _Any
types.description: _Any value scalar as defined by Federation spec.

types.name: _Entity
types.description: _Entity union as defined by Federation spec.

types.name: _Service
types.description: _Service manifest as defined by Federation spec.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByUrl`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: doc
directives.description: Groups fields and operations into named groups.

args.name: category
args.description: Name of the grouping category

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.
